messages.title: My Priorities for Milton Keynes North
messages.content: Newport Pagnell is a beautiful historic market town. But MK Labour’s reckless growth plans would mean we get swallowed up by over-development – Labour would make Newport Pagnell just another suburb of Milton Keynes. I am actively fighting MK Labour and Lib Dem plans to build thousands of houses to the east of the M1. Milton Keynes does need to grow, but growth should be sustainable, and its impact managed properly. Labour is out of touch and out of ideas and is using Newport Pagnell and our local public services that will pay the price for this over development. Join me in standing up for Newport Pagnell and bringing a sensible approach to growth in MK - Vote Conservative on 12th December. A vote for any other party could sabotage all our good work in the area, so on 12th December, vote Ben Everitt to make Milton Keynes North a great place to live, work and enjoy.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Over £200 million extra investment into Milton Keynes University Hospital. This is for both infrastructure and a new pathway centre so everybody receives the best treatment in MK.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Extra Police to Keep Our Streets Safe
keyPolicies.policyDescription: 183 new police officers in recruitment for Thames Valley, rising to 600, and given the powers they need to tackle violent crime so that our streets are safe in Milton Keynes.
From next year we are increasing school funding in Milton Keynes by 6.43%. This is at least £5000 for every pupil here in MK.
Throughout Milton Keynes, there has been over 5000 extra businesses set up in Milton Keynes, including 2255 extra in Milton Keynes North since 2010.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Protecting Milton Keynes from Labour's Plans
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour's reckless building of huge estates and new towns to the east of the M1 would lead to rigid urban boundaries and urban sprawl.

Ensuring hard work is rewarded in MK. A living wage of £8.21 means everybody paying no income tax on the average wage of £91,900 so hard work is rewarded and more money for themselves and their families.

contactInformation.address: Printed and promoted by Peter Geary on behalf of Ben Everitt, both of 7 All Queensway, Bletchley, Milton Keynes MK2 2DZ.
